title: What to Wear to the Final Shows of Taylor Swift's Eras Tour - Inspired by Her Albums
description: After a dominant two years - which have seen Taylor Swift captivate whole cities and economies with her whimsical Eras Tour - the star's history-making concert will officially wrap up in Vancouver, Canada this weekend. For those lucky enough to score tickets to Swift's final shows, we'd argue that the only thing more exciting than seeing the multihyphenate perform live is figuring out what you're going to wear for the occasion. Who better to draw inspiration from for Taylor Swift concert outfit ideas than the singer herself? Her onstage wardrobe is glamorous, eye-catching, and full of hidden messaging - all design flourishes that make for a truly memorable 'fit pic or #GRWM video for your Swift Eras outfit. ICYMI: Swift kicked off her long-awaited tour for Eras in Glendale, AZ, on March 17, 2023. Beyond performing her expansive music catalog, she also provided plenty of fashion moments that pay homage to the aesthetics she's embraced throughout her career - including her latest dark-academia vibe. To celebrate the release of her latest studio album, "The Tortured Poets Department," Swift added an entirely new section to the show which features theatrical performances of songs like "Down Bad" and "But Daddy I Love Him," plus a bevy of fun concert looks from Roberto Cavalli and Vivienne Westwood. View this post on Instagram A post shared by PS (@ps.feelgood) Through all the success of the tour, Taylor Swift's Eras outfits have inspired their own conversation, and even got us rethinking our own concert wardrobe. If you're planning on attending one of her final tour stops in Vancouver this weekend, wondering what to pack for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, or simply want to take a page out of the star's lookbook, we've curated a guide with plenty of Taylor Swift Eras Tour outfit ideas. Featuring plaid shirts, newsboy caps, newspaper-print skirts, and more, these styles draw inspiration from each of her eras and the star's own personal style. From pleated miniskirts that look so tortured and poetic to "Midnights"-inspired shaggy lavender looks and cowgirl boots that'll have you scream-singing "Tim McGraw," these pieces will help you look the part of a true Swiftie. Ahead, shop our favorite Eras Tour outfit ideas with styles from brands like Nasty Gal, Amazon, Net-a-Porter, and Reformation, among others. If you've been wondering what to wear to a Taylor Swift concert, rest assured - we've got you covered with our ultimate guide for the best Taylor Swift concert outfits below. Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfits Taylor Swift "Reputation" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Lover" Outfits Taylor Swift "Red" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Folklore" Outfits Taylor Swift "1989" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Evermore" Outfits Taylor Swift "Speak Now" Outfits Taylor Swift "Fearless" Tour Outfits
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Swifties, this style guide is just for you! ðŸŽ¤
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.After a dominant two years â€” which have seen Taylor Swift captivate whole cities and economies with her whimsical Eras Tour â€” the star's history-making concert will officially wrap up in Vancouver, Canada this weekend. For those lucky enough to score tickets to Swift's final shows, we'd argue that the only thing more exciting than seeing the multihyphenate perform live is figuring out what you're going to wear for the occasion. Who better to draw inspiration from for Taylor Swift concert outfit ideas than the singer herself? Her onstage wardrobe is glamorous, eye-catching, and full of hidden messaging â€” all design flourishes that make for a truly memorable 'fit pic or #GRWM video for your Swift Eras outfit. ICYMI: Swift kicked off her long-awaited tour for Eras in Glendale, AZ, on March 17, 2023. Beyond performing her expansive music catalog, she also provided plenty of fashion moments that pay homage to the aesthetics she's embraced throughout her career â€” including her latest dark-academia vibe. To celebrate the release of her latest studio album, "The Tortured Poets Department," Swift added an entirely new section to the show which features theatrical performances of songs like "Down Bad" and "But Daddy I Love Him," plus a bevy of fun concert looks from Roberto Cavalli and Vivienne Westwood. Through all the success of the tour, Taylor Swift's Eras outfits have inspired their own conversation, and even got us rethinking our own concert wardrobe. If you're planning on attending one of her final tour stops in Vancouver this weekend, wondering what to pack for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, or simply want to take a page out of the star's lookbook, we've curated a guide with plenty of Taylor Swift Eras Tour outfit ideas. Featuring plaid shirts, newsboy caps, newspaper-print skirts, and more, these styles draw inspiration from each of her eras and the star's own personal style. From pleated miniskirts that look so tortured and poetic to "Midnights"-inspired shaggy lavender looks and cowgirl boots that'll have you scream-singing "Tim McGraw," these pieces will help you look the part of a true Swiftie. Ahead, shop our favorite Eras Tour outfit ideas with styles from brands like Nasty Gal, Amazon, Net-a-Porter, and Reformation, among others. If you've been wondering what to wear to a Taylor Swift concert, rest assured â€” we've got you covered with our ultimate guide for the best Taylor Swift concert outfits below. Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfits Taylor Swift "Reputation" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Lover" Outfits Taylor Swift "Red" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Folklore" Outfits Taylor Swift "1989" Tour Outfits Taylor Swift "Evermore" Outfits Taylor Swift "Speak Now" Outfits Taylor Swift "Fearless" Tour Outfits 01amazon.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsYming Button-Down Shirt Dress ($30) We're down bad for Swift's white taffeta Vivienne Westwood dress, which she wears during the "Tortured Poets" section of the Eras Tour. True to theme, the gown features her own lyrics from "Fortnight" printed across the skirt in a romantic cursive font. While we might not be able to afford a custom Vivienne Westwood frock â€” maybe in our wildest dreams â€” we can still channel Swift's Era's outfit with this button-down shirt dress, which features a similar writing all throughout.03amazon.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsGreatlookz Satin Opera Gloves ($4) Leave it to Taylor Swift to tease her "Tortured Poets Department" era at the Grammys, of all places. ICYMI: while attending the 66th Annual Grammy Awards earlier this year, Swift donned a white Schiaparelli Haute Couture gown with romantic black gloves to match. Little did we know, she was actually Easter egging (something Swifties know all too well) the aesthetic of her upcoming era, which she replicated in the "Fortnight" music video alongside Post Malone. You can mirror Taylor Swift's Grammys outfit with these sultry opera gloves from Amazon.04amazon.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsThe Tortured Poets Cocktail Club Tote Bag ($16) Every stadium tends to have a different bag policy, but if you can get away with carrying this cute tote in, it'll make the most darling addition to your Eras Tour outfit. The bag features a romantic print across the front which pulls inspiration from the title track of Swift's latest album release, "The Tortured Poets Department."05amazon.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsSequin Tuxedo Tailcoat ($40) If you've seen videos of Swift's "Tortured Poets" set on TikTok, then you already know that she leans fully into her inner-theater kid within the performance â€” and somehow makes her 3-hour show even better. While she might not actually be performing with a broken heart (at least not these days), Swift certainly knows how to put on a spectacle that showcases all of the emotions present in her songwriting â€” and all while wearing kitten heels and a sparkly tailcoat, no less.06amazon.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsScktoo High-Waisted Pleated Tennis Skirt ($25) As far as "The Tortured Poets Department" tour outfits go, we recommend channeling a dark-academia aesthetic with preppy pieces like this pleated mini skirt. Pair it with an oversize sweatshirt, knee-high socks, and chunky mules for a look that's (you guessed it) so tortured and so poetic.07uncommongoods.comTaylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" OutfitsUncommon Goods Literary Women Book Locket Necklace ($55) Swift embraces her inner-writer with this record, drawing on themes of nostalgia with poetic, moody undertones. These dainty lockets align with the album's vibe while also celebrating the historic works of past literary giants like Jane Austen and Louisa May Alcott.08amazon.comTaylor Swift "Midnights" OutfitsMilumia Casual Multi Striped Knit Top ($15-$23) In the lead-up to the debut of her "Midnights" album, Swift famously posted a slew of Instagram and TikTok videos where she teased the tracklist and gave fans a glimpse of what to expect with her new music. The singer dressed the part of a '70s pop star, often donning stripes, mustard tones, and fitted T-shirts â€” just like this style from Amazon.09amazon.comTaylor Swift "Midnights" Outfit IdeasUnique21 Asymmetrical Blazer Dress ($60) and Sparkle Rhinestone Tights ($9-$10) This blazer dress might not be as statement-making as Swift's shaggy purple coat, but it will definitely have you feeling like you're caught up in a lavender haze â€” thanks to the piece's deep lilac coloring and sexy, fitted design. Style this "Midnights" outfit with white boots and a pair of rhinestone tights for an ensemble that's just as dazzling as you are.10amazon.comTaylor Swift "Midnights" Outfit IdeasFoefaik Fluffy Faux-Fur Coat ($36-$54) Take a page out of Swift's '70s-inspired wardrobe with this shaggy lilac coat from Amazon â€” which will double as the coolest Eras Tour fan outfit. The faux-fur layer might not be quite as dramatic as the one she's worn within her "Lavender Haze" outfit at Eras Tour thus far, but it comes pretty close â€” and is available to shop at a much more affordable price point.11amazon.comTaylor Swift "Reputation" OutfitsReputation Necklace ($15) If you missed out on buying official merch from Taylor Swift's Reputation Tour era, you can still scoop up a cute keepsake that commemorates that iconic album with this silver necklace, which is written in the same font as the singer's album.12amazon.comTaylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit IdeasEllie Shoes Gogo Boots ($29-$56) Throughout her "Reputation" album era, Swift famously swapped out her classic cowgirl boots for a bolder, knee-high style that played into the album's gritty fashion aesthetic. While you might not be able to don the exact pair worn by the star, you can still embrace an edgier look with these glossy black boots from Amazon.13amazon.comTaylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit IdeasSnake Ring ($13) We love this snake ring because it will double as the most perfect addition to any Taylor Swift-inspired outfit â€” especially if you're looking to channel her "Reputation" era (aka Swifties' actual favorite Taylor Swift album), and it'll also serve as a great everyday ring once the concert is over. The silver jewelry piece has a unique design that resembles the look of a snake seamlessly wrapping around your finger.14revolve.comTaylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit IdeasMiaou Atlas Pants ($143, originally $255) You'll make headlines and a stylish statement by incorporating these nostalgic pants into your Eras Tour outfit. The black and white piece features a retro print that's inspired by the look of a classic newspaper â€” a style fad that Swift famously embraced with her own "Reputation" era outfits.15asos.comTaylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit IdeasASOS Only Cami Top ($12, originally $26) Black sparkles were a recurring theme throughout Swift's "Reputation" concert outfits, and with this glittery top, you can easily replicate the star's iconic black outfit for way less. Pair it with a body-hugging mini skirt and knee-high boots for a truly edgy ensemble.16amazon.comTaylor Swift "Lover" OutfitsStriped Sequin Short Romper ($40-$47) When we think back to Swift's "Lover" era outfits, our minds are immediately reminded of the unforgettable "You Need to Calm Down" music video â€” you know, the one that featured rainbow color palettes, butterflies, kiddie pools, and sequins galore. This rainbow romper takes a page straight out of Swift's colorful lookbook with its playful neckline, flirty silhouette, and pastel coloring.17saksfifthavenue.comTaylor Swift "Lover" Outfit IdeasComme des GarÃ§ons Play x Converse Unisex Chuck Taylor Sneakers ($150) You'll likely be standing on your feet for the entirety of the Eras Tour concert (it is a Taylor Swift concert, after all), so naturally, you'll want a comfortable pair of sneakers. These unique high-top sneakers are a favorite of POPSUGAR editors, and even feature a darling heart detailing that feels so on brand with the "Lover" album. Plus, if you're planning on attending several shows, these sneakers will pair beautifully in a number of different Eras Tour outfits.18amazon.comTaylor Swift "Lover" Outfit IdeasSweatyRocks Casual Crop Top T-Shirt ($26) Even if your world isn't plastered in screaming color, at least your wardrobe will be â€” with the help of this pastel, tie-dye top, of course. If you're wondering what to wear to the Eras Tour, this cropped T-shirt is your perfect match as it features a cool tucked-in design at the front, which gives the top a unique look and makes it ideal for styling with pieces like high-waisted leggings or a denim miniskirt.19amazon.comTaylor Swift "Red" OutfitsSportsmusies Panels Newsboy Leather Cap ($20) We know all too well that Swift's "Red" era is a special one for fans of the superstar musician. In the album cover art for "Red (Taylor's Version)," she famously donned a red beret cap that looked curiously similar to this vintage newsboy cap from Amazon. What better way to tap into Swift's "Red" Tour outfits than with this romantic accessroy?20amazon.comTaylor Swift "Red" Outfit IdeasAmazon Essentials Striped French Terry Sweater ($19) Black and white stripes for spring? Actually groundbreaking since the style feels much more synonymous with fall fashion. Still, you'll look and feel like the main character of your own autumnal love story (or rather just the "All Too Well" music video) with the help of this off-the-shoulder striped sweater.21amazon.comTaylor Swift "Red" Outfit IdeasOdema Leather Oxfords ($33-$36) Take your Eras Tour concert outfit to new heights with these leather oxfords. At one point, many of Taylor Swift's outfits seemed to revolve around a shoe quite similar to these, and she was often spotted trotting through the streets of New York and London with the heeled Oxfords in tow. If you're looking for an easy and affordable way to mirror Taylor Swift's clothes, we recommend adding these retro shoes to your wardrobe ASAP.22etsy.comTaylor Swift "Red" Outfit IdeasNot a Lot Going On at the Moment T-Shirt ($7, originally $14) Few musicians have as much fun teasing their fans as Swift. Whether it's with Easter eggs in music videos or ominous Instagram posts (which this simple T-shirt famously references), the star always manages to keep her fans guessing and eagerly awaiting her next surprise album. Given the versatility of Taylor Swift's discography, we can only imagine what album genre she's plotting next.23amazon.comTaylor Swift "Red" Outfit IdeasAllegra K Glitter Sequin V-Neck Party Dress ($38) From putting out an entire album titled "Red" to debuting a track on "Midnights" titled "Maroon," it's clear that Swift has made the romantic color a recurring throughout her music catalogue â€” and rightly so, given how she famously sang that she once believed love would be "burning red." Tap into the musician's color inspiration with this sparkly, Taylor Swift-inspired dress and prepare to turn heads the moment you walk into the stadium.24amazon.comTaylor Swift "Folklore" OutfitsVivivalue Adjustable Flower Headband ($12) Perhaps the easiest way to tap into the woodsy and fairytale-like aesthetic of Swift's "Folklore" era is with a classic flower crown. This flower crown will elevate even the most muted outfit with an ethereal flair. Given that you've probably already spent a decent amount of money just buying the actual concert tickets, we love how affordable this accessory is, too.25amazon.comTaylor Swift "Folklore" Outfit IdeasAsymmetrical Tulle Skirt ($25, originally $30) Channel your inner fairy-warrior-goddess with this asymmetrical tulle skirt from Amazon. The ethereal piece feels like a blend between Swift's "folklore" and "evermore" eras, which is great, because you'll be able to create a look that combines everyone's favorite sister records into one.26saksfifthavenue.comTaylor Swift "Folklore" Outfit IdeasMac Duggal Long-Sleeve Embroidered Floral Minidress ($398) While Swift never wore a floral dress like this designer style in any of her "Folklore" music videos or promotional art, she did sport a pretty similar style when winning the top award at the 2021 Grammys ceremony for the folksy album. This embroidered piece doubles as the perfect dupe for the Oscar de la Renta minidress and will have you looking like a true folklorian goddess.27amazon.comTaylor Swift "1989" OutfitsPergozo Pink Heart Sunglasses ($10) Everything we love about the retro, pop-infused vibes of the "1989" album comes to life in these heart sunnies. While Swift has rocked her own pair of heart-shaped sunglasses through a number of different eras (namely in the "22" music video), something about the accessory takes us back to her glorious, New York-obsessed days. Plus, with rumors swirling that "1989 (Taylor's Version)" will be the star's next re-recording, you'll be prepped and ready to tap into Taylor Swift's style from the album the moment it drops.28revolve.comTaylor Swift "1989" Outfit IdeasSNDYS Audrina Top ($64) If you'd rather opt for a simple and more comfortable concert outfit, we recommend shopping out something like this shimmery style. The sparkly crop top is wrapped in crystal glass embellishments that are eye-catching but not too overbearing. The silver coloring is reminiscent of the glitzy pieces Swift wore throughout her "1989" era, and the tank top would look so cute paired with high-waisted jeans and classic white sneakers.29amazon.comTaylor Swift "1989" Outfit IdeasAnna-Kaci Sequin Long Sleeve Front Zip Jacket ($45) There's something so preppy and fun about this gold, sequin-embellished zipper jacket from Amazon. Even as she's grown up, Swift has always managed to weave in themes of high school politics and love into her songs â€” particularly in tracks like "Miss Americana and the Heartbreak Prince." If you want to pay homage to your own adolescent days with a high school-inspired 'fit, this statement-making piece is a great buy.30amazon.comTaylor Swift "Evermore" OutfitsBeaully Flannel Plaid Jacket ($36) If you went through the 2016 craze of flannels and oversize plaid shirts, then it's likely you already have an "Evermore" era-inspired outfit nestled within your closet. But if you're looking for a more specific style that pays homage to Swift's album cover trench coat, then we recommend scooping up this orange-hued layer from Amazon. Pair it with black boots and a classic braid, and you'll be good to go.31dsw.comTaylor Swift "Evermore" Outfit IdeasDr. Martens 1460 Boots ($170) Nothing feels more primed for an autumnal walk in the woods like these black Dr. Martens boots, which means you'll also be channeling peak-"Evermore" vibes just wearing them. The matte black style features a cool, lace-up design, so you can adjust the shoes to match your preferred outfit.32amazon.comTaylor Swift "Speak Now" OutfitsTopdress Halter Retro Cocktail Dress ($37) Slip into this deep-purple halter dress, and you'll be transported back to the very first time you saw Swift perform live â€” especially if you attended the "Speak Now" tour, where she donned a similar cocktail dress and belted out romantic ballads like "Sparks Fly" along with heartbreaking hits like "Dear John." If you're lucky, she might even include a song from that enchanting era in her surprise setlist for the concert.33amazon.comTaylor Swift "Speak Now" Outfit IdeasFuncredible Purple Light Up Cowboy Hat ($10, originally $25) Swift has been relying on lots of different purple hues to tease her long-awaited rerecorded album, "Speak Now (Taylor's Version)" â€” and the city of Nashville even lit up different landmarks in her signature color to help celebrate the announcement of the album's summer release date. This iridescent cowboy hat will help you pay homage to Swift's "Speak Now" era, while also tapping into the funky, lavender haze-inspired vibe of her "Midnights" record. Since Taylor Swift's "Speak Now" album was filled with lots of purple gowns and sparkles, basically anything within that realm will pass the vibe check.34amazon.comTaylor Swift "Fearless" OutfitsTanming Casual Embroidered Pearls Beading Denim Jacket ($33) Swift's "Fearless" era is one of our absolute favorites, because it's when we saw our country-born girl grow a bit more into her own pop star sensibilities. This jacket pays homage to that transition with its country-chic design and darling pearl embellishments across the top.35amazon.comTaylor Swift "Fearless" Outfit IdeasAminugal Embroidered Western Cowboy Boots ($27-$30) While Swift has metaphorically (and maybe even literally) hung up her cowgirl boots in the music space, her debut and "Fearless" albums are still just as unforgettable today as they were when she first released them. Who can forget what it felt like to scream-sing "Love Story" in the car for the first time? With these white mid-calf boots, you can honor the musician's country roots and manifest that she'll sing one of her original breakup ballads, too.36amazon.comTaylor Swift "Fearless" Outfit IdeasSpinningdaisy Crystal Electric Hanging Guitar Earrings ($29) You might not be able to sneak an actual bedazzled guitar through stadium security, but with these glitzy guitar earrings, you can pay homage to Swift's "Fearless" concert tour outfits, which blended country girl-chic with a hint of a pop star on the rise.Kyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer, editor, and affiliate strategist with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She currently works as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. She previously worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

After a dominant two years â€” which have seen Taylor Swift captivate whole cities and economies with her whimsical Eras Tour â€” the star's history-making concert will officially wrap up in Vancouver, Canada this weekend. For those lucky enough to score tickets to Swift's final shows, we'd argue that the only thing more exciting than seeing the multihyphenate perform live is figuring out what you're going to wear for the occasion. Who better to draw inspiration from for Taylor Swift concert outfit ideas than the singer herself? Her onstage wardrobe is glamorous, eye-catching, and full of hidden messaging â€” all design flourishes that make for a truly memorable 'fit pic or #GRWM video for your Swift Eras outfit.

ICYMI: Swift kicked off her long-awaited tour for Eras in Glendale, AZ, on March 17, 2023. Beyond performing her expansive music catalog, she also provided plenty of fashion moments that pay homage to the aesthetics she's embraced throughout her career â€” including her latest dark-academia vibe. To celebrate the release of her latest studio album, "The Tortured Poets Department," Swift added an entirely new section to the show which features theatrical performances of songs like "Down Bad" and "But Daddy I Love Him," plus a bevy of fun concert looks from Roberto Cavalli and Vivienne Westwood.

Through all the success of the tour, Taylor Swift's Eras outfits have inspired their own conversation, and even got us rethinking our own concert wardrobe. If you're planning on attending one of her final tour stops in Vancouver this weekend, wondering what to pack for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, or simply want to take a page out of the star's lookbook, we've curated a guide with plenty of Taylor Swift Eras Tour outfit ideas. Featuring plaid shirts, newsboy caps, newspaper-print skirts, and more, these styles draw inspiration from each of her eras and the star's own personal style.

From pleated miniskirts that look so tortured and poetic to "Midnights"-inspired shaggy lavender looks and cowgirl boots that'll have you scream-singing "Tim McGraw," these pieces will help you look the part of a true Swiftie. Ahead, shop our favorite Eras Tour outfit ideas with styles from brands like Nasty Gal, Amazon, Net-a-Porter, and Reformation, among others. If you've been wondering what to wear to a Taylor Swift concert, rest assured â€” we've got you covered with our ultimate guide for the best Taylor Swift concert outfits below.

  • Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Reputation" Tour Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Lover" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Red" Tour Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Folklore" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "1989" Tour Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Evermore" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Speak Now" Outfits
  • Taylor Swift "Fearless" Tour Outfits

01

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

Yming Button-Down Shirt Dress ($30)

We're down bad for Swift's white taffeta Vivienne Westwood dress, which she wears during the "Tortured Poets" section of the Eras Tour. True to theme, the gown features her own lyrics from "Fortnight" printed across the skirt in a romantic cursive font. While we might not be able to afford a custom Vivienne Westwood frock â€” maybe in our wildest dreams â€” we can still channel Swift's Era's outfit with this button-down shirt dress, which features a similar writing all throughout.

03

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

Greatlookz Satin Opera Gloves ($4)

Leave it to Taylor Swift to tease her "Tortured Poets Department" era at the Grammys, of all places. ICYMI: while attending the 66th Annual Grammy Awards earlier this year, Swift donned a white Schiaparelli Haute Couture gown with romantic black gloves to match. Little did we know, she was actually Easter egging (something Swifties know all too well) the aesthetic of her upcoming era, which she replicated in the "Fortnight" music video alongside Post Malone. You can mirror Taylor Swift's Grammys outfit with these sultry opera gloves from Amazon.

04

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

The Tortured Poets Cocktail Club Tote Bag ($16)

Every stadium tends to have a different bag policy, but if you can get away with carrying this cute tote in, it'll make the most darling addition to your Eras Tour outfit. The bag features a romantic print across the front which pulls inspiration from the title track of Swift's latest album release, "The Tortured Poets Department."

05

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

Sequin Tuxedo Tailcoat ($40)

If you've seen videos of Swift's "Tortured Poets" set on TikTok, then you already know that she leans fully into her inner-theater kid within the performance â€” and somehow makes her 3-hour show even better. While she might not actually be performing with a broken heart (at least not these days), Swift certainly knows how to put on a spectacle that showcases all of the emotions present in her songwriting â€” and all while wearing kitten heels and a sparkly tailcoat, no less.

06

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

Scktoo High-Waisted Pleated Tennis Skirt ($25)

As far as "The Tortured Poets Department" tour outfits go, we recommend channeling a dark-academia aesthetic with preppy pieces like this pleated mini skirt. Pair it with an oversize sweatshirt, knee-high socks, and chunky mules for a look that's (you guessed it) so tortured and so poetic.

07

Taylor Swift "The Tortured Poets Department" Outfits

Uncommon Goods Literary Women Book Locket Necklace ($55)

Swift embraces her inner-writer with this record, drawing on themes of nostalgia with poetic, moody undertones. These dainty lockets align with the album's vibe while also celebrating the historic works of past literary giants like Jane Austen and Louisa May Alcott.

08

Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfits

Milumia Casual Multi Striped Knit Top ($15-$23)

In the lead-up to the debut of her "Midnights" album, Swift famously posted a slew of Instagram and TikTok videos where she teased the tracklist and gave fans a glimpse of what to expect with her new music. The singer dressed the part of a '70s pop star, often donning stripes, mustard tones, and fitted T-shirts â€” just like this style from Amazon.

09

Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfit Ideas

Unique21 Asymmetrical Blazer Dress ($60) and Sparkle Rhinestone Tights ($9-$10)

This blazer dress might not be as statement-making as Swift's shaggy purple coat, but it will definitely have you feeling like you're caught up in a lavender haze â€” thanks to the piece's deep lilac coloring and sexy, fitted design. Style this "Midnights" outfit with white boots and a pair of rhinestone tights for an ensemble that's just as dazzling as you are.

10

Taylor Swift "Midnights" Outfit Ideas

Foefaik Fluffy Faux-Fur Coat ($36-$54)

Take a page out of Swift's '70s-inspired wardrobe with this shaggy lilac coat from Amazon â€” which will double as the coolest Eras Tour fan outfit. The faux-fur layer might not be quite as dramatic as the one she's worn within her "Lavender Haze" outfit at Eras Tour thus far, but it comes pretty close â€” and is available to shop at a much more affordable price point.

11

Taylor Swift "Reputation" Outfits

Reputation Necklace ($15)

If you missed out on buying official merch from Taylor Swift's Reputation Tour era, you can still scoop up a cute keepsake that commemorates that iconic album with this silver necklace, which is written in the same font as the singer's album.

12

Taylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit Ideas

Ellie Shoes Gogo Boots ($29-$56)

Throughout her "Reputation" album era, Swift famously swapped out her classic cowgirl boots for a bolder, knee-high style that played into the album's gritty fashion aesthetic. While you might not be able to don the exact pair worn by the star, you can still embrace an edgier look with these glossy black boots from Amazon.

13

Taylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit Ideas

Snake Ring ($13)

We love this snake ring because it will double as the most perfect addition to any Taylor Swift-inspired outfit â€” especially if you're looking to channel her "Reputation" era (aka Swifties' actual favorite Taylor Swift album), and it'll also serve as a great everyday ring once the concert is over. The silver jewelry piece has a unique design that resembles the look of a snake seamlessly wrapping around your finger.

14

Taylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit Ideas

Miaou Atlas Pants ($143, originally $255)

You'll make headlines and a stylish statement by incorporating these nostalgic pants into your Eras Tour outfit. The black and white piece features a retro print that's inspired by the look of a classic newspaper â€” a style fad that Swift famously embraced with her own "Reputation" era outfits.

15

Taylor Swift "Reputation" Outfit Ideas

ASOS Only Cami Top ($12, originally $26)

Black sparkles were a recurring theme throughout Swift's "Reputation" concert outfits, and with this glittery top, you can easily replicate the star's iconic black outfit for way less. Pair it with a body-hugging mini skirt and knee-high boots for a truly edgy ensemble.

16

Taylor Swift "Lover" Outfits

Striped Sequin Short Romper ($40-$47)

When we think back to Swift's "Lover" era outfits, our minds are immediately reminded of the unforgettable "You Need to Calm Down" music video â€” you know, the one that featured rainbow color palettes, butterflies, kiddie pools, and sequins galore.
